verses.verse: Then Moses <S%H4872><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to the heads <S%H7218><s%> of the tribes <S%H4294><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "This <S%H2088><s%> is the word <S%H1697><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has commanded. <S%H6680><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> makes <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> or <S%H176><s%> takes <S%H7650><s%> an oath <S%H7621><s%> to bind <S%H631><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> with a binding <S%H632><s%> obligation, <S%H632><s%> he shall not violate <S%H2490><s%> his word; <S%H1697><s%> he shall do <S%H6213><s%> according to all <S%H3605><s%> that proceeds <S%H3318><s%> out of his mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

"Also if <S%H3588><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> makes <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and binds <S%H631><s%> herself by an obligation <S%H632><s%> in her father's house <S%H1004><s%> in her youth, <S%H5271><s%>

and her father hears <S%H1><s%> her vow <S%H8085><s%> and her obligation <S%H5088><s%> by which <S%H632><s%> she has bound <S%H834><s%> herself, <S%H631><s%> and her father says <S%H5315><s%> nothing <S%H1><s%> to her, then all <S%H2790><s%> her vows <S%H2790><s%> shall stand, <S%H3605><s%> and every <S%H5088><s%> obligation <S%H6965><s%> by which <S%H3605><s%> she has bound <S%H632><s%> herself <S%H834><s%> shall stand. <S%H631><s%>

"But if <S%H518><s%> her father should forbid <S%H1><s%> her on the day <S%H5106><s%> he hears <S%H3117><s%> [of it,] none <S%H8085><s%> <S%H3605><s%> of her vows <S%H3808><s%> or her obligations <S%H5088><s%> by which <S%H632><s%> she has bound <S%H834><s%> herself <S%H631><s%> shall stand; <S%H5315><s%> and the Lord <S%H6965><s%> will forgive <S%H3068><s%> her because <S%H5545><s%> her father had forbidden <S%H3588><s%> her.

"However, if <S%H518><s%> she should marry <S%H1961><s%> <S%H376><s%> while under <S%H5921><s%> her vows <S%H5088><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the rash <S%H4008><s%> statement <S%H4008><s%> of her lips <S%H8193><s%> by which <S%H834><s%> she has bound <S%H631><s%> herself, <S%H5315><s%>

and her husband <S%H376><s%> hears <S%H8085><s%> of it and says <S%H2790><s%> nothing <S%H2790><s%> to her on the day <S%H3117><s%> he hears <S%H8085><s%> [it,] then her vows <S%H5088><s%> shall stand <S%H6965><s%> and her obligations <S%H632><s%> by which <S%H834><s%> she has bound <S%H631><s%> herself <S%H5315><s%> shall stand. <S%H6965><s%>

"But if <S%H518><s%> on the day <S%H3117><s%> her husband <S%H376><s%> hears <S%H8085><s%> [of it,] he forbids <S%H5106><s%> her, then he shall annul <S%H6565><s%> her vow <S%H5088><s%> which <S%H834><s%> she is under <S%H5921><s%> and the rash <S%H4008><s%> statement <S%H4008><s%> of her lips <S%H8193><s%> by which <S%H834><s%> she has bound <S%H631><s%> herself; <S%H5315><s%> and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will forgive <S%H5545><s%> her.

"But the vow <S%H5088><s%> of a widow <S%H490><s%> or of a divorced <S%H1644><s%> woman, everything <S%H3605><s%> by which <S%H834><s%> she has bound <S%H631><s%> herself, <S%H5315><s%> shall stand <S%H6965><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> her.

"However, if <S%H518><s%> she vowed <S%H5087><s%> in her husband's house, <S%H1004><s%> or <S%H176><s%> bound <S%H631><s%> herself <S%H5315><s%> by an obligation <S%H632><s%> with an oath, <S%H7621><s%>

and her husband <S%H376><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> [it,] but said <S%H2790><s%> nothing <S%H2790><s%> to her [and] did not forbid <S%H5106><s%> her, then all <S%H3605><s%> her vows <S%H5088><s%> shall stand, <S%H6965><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> obligation <S%H632><s%> by which <S%H834><s%> she bound <S%H631><s%> herself <S%H5315><s%> shall stand. <S%H6965><s%>

"But if <S%H518><s%> her husband <S%H376><s%> indeed <S%H6565><s%> annuls <S%H6565><s%> them on the day <S%H3117><s%> he hears <S%H8085><s%> [them,] then whatever <S%H3605><s%> proceeds <S%H4161><s%> out of her lips <S%H8193><s%> concerning her vows <S%H5088><s%> or concerning the obligation <S%H632><s%> of herself, <S%H5315><s%> shall not stand; <S%H6965><s%> her husband <S%H376><s%> has annulled <S%H6565><s%> them, and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will forgive <S%H5545><s%> her.

"Every <S%H3605><s%> vow <S%H5088><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> binding <S%H632><s%> oath <S%H7621><s%> to humble <S%H6031><s%> herself, <S%H5315><s%> her husband <S%H376><s%> may confirm <S%H6965><s%> it or her husband <S%H376><s%> may annul <S%H6565><s%> it.

"But if <S%H518><s%> her husband <S%H376><s%> indeed <S%H2790><s%> says <S%H2790><s%> nothing <S%H2790><s%> to her from day <S%H3117><s%> to day, <S%H3117><s%> then he confirms <S%H6965><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her vows <S%H5088><s%> or <S%H176><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her obligations <S%H632><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are on her; he has confirmed <S%H6965><s%> them, because <S%H3588><s%> he said <S%H2790><s%> nothing <S%H2790><s%> to her on the day <S%H3117><s%> he heard <S%H8085><s%> them.
"But if <S%H518><s%> he indeed <S%H6565><s%> annuls <S%H6565><s%> them after <S%H310><s%> he has heard <S%H8085><s%> them, then he shall bear <S%H5375><s%> her guilt. <S%H5771><s%>"

These <S%H428><s%> are the statutes <S%H2706><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> Moses, <S%H4872><s%> [as] between <S%H996><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> and his wife, <S%H802><s%> [and as] between <S%H996><s%> a father and his daughter, <S%H1><s%> [while she is] in her youth <S%H1323><s%> in her father's house. <S%H5271><s%>
